column4: morphynor I'm not hacking anything. . . three people have already given me permission to use their networks. . . I'm simply trying to find a program that'll give me decently accurate signal strengths so that I can decide which to try for. . . something similar to netstumbler I used with windows
iwlist scan?
where? how?
in terminal
interface doesn't support scanning. . .
you most likely dont have your wireless modules installed
wlan shows scan completed, sweet, this'll work!
try: ifconfig wlan0 up
ok, cool
n/m
I'm on wireless now
just be careful with iwlist scan... the fcc might come knockin on your door if you use it too much
if I use it too much? there's nothin' they can do. . .
signal level and noise level, measured in dBm. . . how can I convert that into a logical memasure? or is there a scale to it?
DoD watchlist
so? I'm using it to get access to networks I've been permissed to use
you dont know the full potential of the software your using
ive said too much already
it tells me the encryption key is set to off. . . when there is a key will it show me something different?
other than the fact that there is one?
yeah... "on"
is there a simple way to make sense of the dBm measurements?
it usually breaks down to a channel, 1 thru 11 i believe
what do you mean about breaking down channels?
